findings.title: A floating pragma is set (SWC-103)
findings.description: The Solidity version used in the contract is not fixed, which can lead to unexpected behavior and security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Use of “tx.origin” as part of authorization control (SWC-115)
findings.description: The 'tx.origin' variable is used as part of authorization control, which can lead to unauthorized access and potential security risks.

findings.title: Potential use of “block.number” as source of randomness (SWC-120)
findings.description: Using block.number as a source of randomness can be insecure because it is predictable and can be manipulated by miners.

findings.title: Read of persistent state following external call / Write to persistent state following external call (SWC - 107)
findings.description: This finding indicates a potential vulnerability where the contract reads or writes to its persistent state after making an external call. This can lead to unintended behavior and security risks.

findings.title: Deployer can mint after deployment
findings.description: The deployer has the capability to mint tokens even after the initial deployment.

findings.title: Deployer can burn
findings.description: The deployer has the capability to burn tokens.

findings.title: Deployer can pause
findings.description: The deployer or admin has the capability to pause/unpause the contract.
